elements.desc:
# <mercury-paginator> > A element providing a solution to paginate lists (Polymer 1.0 compatible). ## Demo [Check it live!](https://github.com/bquarks/mercury-paginator) ## Install Install the component using [Bower](http://bower.io/): ```sh $ bower install mercury-paginator --save ``` Or [download as ZIP](https://github.com/bquarks/mercury-paginator/archive/master.zip). ## Usage 1. Import polyfill: ```html ``` 2. Import custom element: ```html ``` 3. Start using it! ```html ``` ## Usage Specifies an array of elements to the component through the *items* property and set *perpage* property to a pagination number You can use *iron-ajax* element to fetch data from server. ## Development In order to run it locally you'll need to fetch some dependencies and a basic server setup. 1. Install [bower](http://bower.io/) & [polyserve](https://npmjs.com/polyserve): ```sh $ npm install -g bower polyserve ``` 2. Install local dependencies: ```sh $ bower install ``` 3. Start development server and open `http://localhost:8080/components/my-repo/`. ```sh $ polyserve ``` ## History For detailed changelog, check [Releases](https://github.com/jorguezz/mercury-paginator/releases). ## License [MIT License](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) Example:
Id
Item name
Description

*
     * Called when the current page changes
     *
     * @param {Object} page
     * @event pager-change

events.name: pager-change

events.desc: Called when navigating to the next page

jsdoc.description: Called when navigating to the next page

*
     * Called when navigating to the next page
     *
     * @param {Object} page
     * @event pager-next

events.name: pager-next

events.desc: Called when navigating to the previous page

*
     * Called when navigating to the previous page
     *
     * @param {Object} page
     * @event pager-previous

events.name: pager-previous

properties.name: currentpage
properties.desc:
The `currentpage` attribute specifies the
current active page in view

properties.name: currentRange
properties.desc:
The `currentRange` property specifies the
range of pages (e.g 1, 2, 3, 4, 5) to display

properties.name: data
properties.desc:
The `data` attribute is the complete set of data we
wish to be paginated

properties.name: firstPage
properties.desc: Navigate to the first page

properties.name: getPageCount
properties.desc: Get total pages

properties.name: items
properties.desc: The `items` property is the cached instance of the model data for pagination

properties.name: lastPage
properties.desc: Navigate to the last page

properties.name: next
properties.desc:
The `next` attribute specifies the label
for the Next button

properties.name: nextPage
properties.desc: Navigate to the next page

properties.name: pageCount
properties.desc: The `pageCount` specifies the number of paginated pages

properties.name: perpage
properties.desc:
The `perpage` attribute defines the number
of items to show per page

properties.name: previous
properties.desc:
The `previous` attribute specifies the label
for the Previous button

properties.name: prevPage
properties.desc: Navigate to the previous page

properties.name: rangeSize
properties.desc: The `rangeSize` attribute specifies the total size * of the paginated range of items

properties.name: setPage
properties.desc: Set the currentpage  new model data

properties.name: _currentPageChanged
properties.desc: Called when the current page changes

properties.name: _disableNextBtn
properties.desc: Disable next buttom if currentpage page is equal pagecount

properties.name: _disablePrevBtn
properties.desc: Disable prev buttom if currentpage page is 0

# <mercury-paginator> > A element providing a solution to paginate lists (Polymer 1.0 compatible). ## Demo [Check it live!](https://github.com/bquarks/mercury-paginator) ## Install Install the component using [Bower](http://bower.io/): ```sh $ bower install mercury-paginator --save ``` Or [download as ZIP](https://github.com/bquarks/mercury-paginator/archive/master.zip). ## Usage 1. Import polyfill: ```html ``` 2. Import custom element: ```html ``` 3. Start using it! ```html ``` ## Usage Specifies an array of elements to the component through the *items* property and set *perpage* property to a pagination number You can use *iron-ajax* element to fetch data from server. ## Development In order to run it locally you'll need to fetch some dependencies and a basic server setup. 1. Install [bower](http://bower.io/) & [polyserve](https://npmjs.com/polyserve): ```sh $ npm install -g bower polyserve ``` 2. Install local dependencies: ```sh $ bower install ``` 3. Start development server and open `http://localhost:8080/components/my-repo/`. ```sh $ polyserve ``` ## History For detailed changelog, check [Releases](https://github.com/jorguezz/mercury-paginator/releases). ## License [MIT License](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) Example:
